answers.answer: Has she had a blood sugar check to check for diabetes?  Urinating frequently and bladder infections are symptoms.It's worth ruling out - sounds like it could be a lot of things . . .best wishes.

question: My daughter has had a few Bladder Infections now within the past year and another time where I was certain she had one but the test came back negative.  Her main symptom has been running to the bathroom like every 5min. literally.   I requested further evaluation since this has been an ongoing issue.   Their are times where I'm not even certain she's going just feeling like she has to.  She just turned 5yrs old so for her to really go into detail about what's going on isn't gonna happen.  The doc. setup a renal ultrasound and for us to meet with a urologist.  Is this standard and what could be causing all this?
title: Bladder Infections
